Reviews.Title: “Very Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Nessieontour
Reviews.Content: I would never stay here again. The only good point is the location but that is it! Well that and the fact I no longer have to sleep there!! The room decor was so dated, it didn't feel clean and there were marks all over the walls, curtains and bed valance. Mainly burn marks but it just made me itch.This was supposed to be a delux twin. It made travelodge look like a boutique hotel!! From reading the other reviews before I went I would like to know where the friendly staff were because the guy who checked us in wanted to be anywhere else but there. He didnt welcome us, didnt give us any information about the area, hotel, anything! He just shoved us a key and asked us to pay. I wish I had looked at the room before paying as I think I would have just walked out and gone elsewhere. There was a washing machine that was on spin every morning about 8.30 that practically vibrated the room, it was ridiculously noisy! You can hear what everyone is doing in the rooms around you and it looks like the rooms have just been crammed in hickedly pickeldy to ram as many people in as possible. Not what is shown on the website at all!! We did have a room that looked onto the square which was super noisy all night long! That isnt the hotels fault but just a warning in case you would like some sleep. I really dont think this was great value and I will never go back or recommend this hotel to anyone! Really disapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms are all different”
Reviews.Author: Jasper L
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect, there is a wide variety of rooms. Don't hesitate to ask for another room when the one they give you is not to your taste. Some rooms can be very, very noisy. It didn't bother me, but my partner had troubles sleeping. Prices are very decent. All in all a reasonably good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Staff - Clean Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MICKGlasgow
Reviews.Content: arrived there 21st march for 2 days... seen it many times but first time stayed.. Initial observations.. PRICE - Late deal at Â£85 not bad!! LOCATION - great, in rembrant square so 10-15 min walk one way to leidesplien & vondlepark & same the other way to dam square RLD etc.. STAFF - friendly. ROOM - small & fairly clean - only negative was that the walls are paper thin & could hear next room talking all the time ( otherwise would have got 4*).. quite otherwise at the back so didnt hear much of the nightclubs just outside the hotel.. BREAKFAST (optional @ 7 euro) - dissapointing & bland - just cold meats, eggs cereal juice & coffee... ok but not worth 7 euro - theres a supermarket round the corner - go there for breakfast stuff... MINI BAR IN ROOM - chocolate etc - never touched it - 2 euro for each item!....... negatives - not many (5% city tax on everything) - would consider staying here again if a good deal ... worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely budget hotel on a superb location”
Reviews.Author: DennisV
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a surprise I must say. You get what you pay for (some negative reactions here seem to forget that!!). I work in a travel agency, and I saw the prices for individuel bookings at the front desk. I think you are a lot cheaper when you book through a travel agency and not directly to the hotel itself! The rooms are small indeed, same for the beds. But for the price you pay, what do you expect...The location is perfect! The staff is very friendly and the breakfast is rather simple but good. If I need a cheap hotel in the centre of Amsterdam, I would definately go back to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel but awesome spot”
Reviews.Author: carpathian777
Reviews.Content: The rooms are of an average size, bathroom was clean and standard in size. No tea or coffee in the room though. Of a night, especially weekends it can get very noisy and lots of light coming from the street into the room. With this though, our sleep was not overly interrupted. Staff very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ? No, a hostel - AVOID”
Reviews.Author: Robokee
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hostel / hotel i've ever stopped at. I think they've got a cheek calling it a hotel. If you plan to stay here, be prepared for cramped, claustrophobic, noisy rooms with no amenities, unless you want to pay Hilton prices for a room with a bath. We opened the door to room 30 to be greeted by a bed. Not a big bed, nor a comfortable bed. A bed. We could have cried at the tiny, dirty room. A previous guest had stuck a cheap picture of what looked like Jim Morrison on the back of the door which had been left for some time, nice touch. The walls of the rooms are paper thin as you can hear everything going on in adjoining rooms and further. I saw a couple who had just checked at reception, both crying at the state of their room. Not really what you want after a days travelling. You need some level of mountaineering skills too, to first of all climb the entrance stairs. I've never seen stairs as steep. This can't be good for children and i'd say near impossible for the elderly. And there is no lift either. The corridors were way too narrow and a door going on to the second floor, opens out over another ridiculously steep staircase. So dangerous, especially when carrying luggage. As lovely and peaceful Rembrandt Square is in the day, and it is, it certainly livens up in the evening, through to 5am the next morning. Then at 7.45am, the roadworks start, bottle recycling starts, food deliveries start, etc. When we go again to Amsterdam, we would visit Rembrandt Square in the evening and stop in a quiet hotel away from the square. I'd recommend St. James Gate pub, located directly below the Atlanta Hotel for food. Welcoming staff and busy with a good atmosphere. Food was always good. One to avoid is The Old Bell on the right hand corner of the square. Poor service and very expensive. The Dutch are really friendly and helpful and at no time did we feel intimidated or uneasy, even in the red light district. The only negative here was the noisy, lairy English guys, hammered on weed, trying to do business with working girls. A desperate conversation for both parties. I was amazed at how many immigrants were there sponging off tourists but this seemed to be in the red light district only. Macedonians, Moroccans. You can't miss them. They're your best friend until you ignore them. Seriously, if you're going to Amsterdam, avoid the Atlanta Hotel. Use it as a last resort. There are loads of other hotels around. You will not be impressed with this one.

Reviews.Title: “most poorly run hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: todd27
Reviews.Content: 2 weeks before my arrivel date i had a phone call saying they over booked me and tried to re book me to the hotel over the road which after reading trip advisor's reviews, which stated "HOTEL FROM HELL" pretty much summed up the atlanta hotel. They managed to secure my booking however on arrivel we were told the same thing, then told we can go to the room but they dont have towels, then to be told they can not locate the room card, then to be told the system has gone down. We had to be let in to our room so had no electric then had to chase this situation up twice. Four hours later we got our room card. We booked a deluxe room but nothing deluxe about this room at all very very loud at night etc etc!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, good as a base but not very comfortable for a long stay”
Reviews.Author: weekender79
Reviews.Content: I booked single room with shared bathroom for 3 nights â‚¬63 a night without breakfast. 24 hour reception and Staff v friendly and nice. Wifi does not work in all of the hotel and didn't in my room. Room was fairly clean with a safe which was a bonus. No hangars for clothes and only one small drawer but was warm and had clean towels each day. My room was at the back and quiet, Rembrandt square side is noisy. I had very nice trip. Hotel was fine for me, a bit overpriced for the facilities maybe, but such a central location makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money but shared bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: emar_1978
Reviews.Content: bit noisy at nights, locations is great,hotel is clean, staff is nice but bathrooms are shared on each floor. overall a nice hotel and a great holiday

Reviews.Title: “Short break”
Reviews.Author: Sarah B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very clean room and the staff were very friendly, unfortunately very hard to get to sleep due to night life. Ideal if you enjoy night life!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: We were made very wecolme on arrival, our room was clean and tidy, nothing was too much trouble, we would certainly recommend your hotel to family and friends, looking forward to our stay 10/10. Mr C Rippin & Mr D Mills.

Reviews.Title: “good location, great value”
Reviews.Author: mousie83
Reviews.Content: I was here for one night before catching a flight the next day. For the location, the price is pretty reasonable and they provide free wifi. From Rembrandt square you are pretty much able to reach a lot of touristy places by foot. By tram would also be a good option if you don't feel like walking or have luggage to carry around. Overall great value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, about 10 minutes walk to central square and 10 minutes walk to Leidsplien. Rembrandt square is a lively square with supermarkets, clubs, coffeshops, cafes and restaraunts all nearby. The room me and my friend stayed in was very small but cosy, few stains on the bed covers and a bit dusty however if you dont mind staying somewhere for a reasonable price and a great location this is fine. The toilet on the first floor did not flush which was quite annoying as it blocked up easily, however toilet and shower areas were both clean. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible for the price”
Reviews.Author: lisau28
Reviews.Content: We paid an incredibly low price for this hotel in comparison to what else was available. About the same price as two dorm beds, and we received a very clean room in a fantastic location. On the fringe of the central part of the city, the hotel was right next to a plethora of stores, restaurants, shops, bars. It is located in a square, with many bars and restaurants. While we were there, it was fairly quiet as it was in the middle of winter and too cold to sit outside. The tram stops right outside the left of the hotel, and it was only a 5 minute ride to Amsterdam central. Staff were helpful and friendly, and the shared bathrooms were decent. Small hallways, but to be expected for housing in a land limited city. From here, we walked to all the sights in the city. Pleasant and safe area. The room was reasonably sized with a sink and small tv. Ours looked onto the square.

Reviews.Title: “The Atlanta Hotel - Well Done”
Reviews.Author: bonkersmoronico
Reviews.Content: Booked it as it was cheap and in a great location. Free wifi, it does not need anything as its next to great bars, restaurants, clubs and cinemas. Then on all sides you have Amsterdam itself. Anyone who goes to Amsterdam and expects to stay in their hotel and not go out do not go here as it is basic. That said the shower was hot and everywhere was clean. It has traditional dutch stairs so if you are overweight or disabled do not stay here. I found the staff great and friendly. The hotel was safe with a locked door operated by a receptionist. Thanks again for making this trip to Amsterdam so easy. Would definitely use next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and central!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan D
Reviews.Content: I recently came here for a weekend in Amsterdam with some friends and had a great stay. The staff were friendly and very helfpul in giving good tips for restaurants and places to go out to. Best of all, the location was central which meant we were within walking distance to everything which we wanted to see. As for the rooms, they were simple, neat and tidy. Definately a place I would come back to!!

Reviews.Title: “It works”
Reviews.Author: Rolleri
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with my friends for three nights. Boys having fun, was the plan. And it worked out very well. About the Hotel Atlanta. Clean, safe (felt like it) and absolutely well situated. Room quiet even on the square side, where the action was. Nice cafes and coffeshops around the lively Rembrants square. A lot of stairs in the hotel. Feeling was like in a small London hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive , poor services , very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: mandelajunior
Reviews.Content: I had one of the most terrible stays in my life in this hotel . The rooms are very small you can't move inside you room - I was alone - very small bed , very terrible condition . When it comes to food there is nothing to eat in this hotel . Overall it is very expensive

Reviews.Title: “9 Pleasant Days in the Atlanta”
Reviews.Author: Andrea P
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have had a great time at the Atlanta! Nice boutique hotel with friendly staff, clean rooms and great location. The stairs are Amsterdam-style (i.e. steep) with no elevator though, so not advisable for those who have a lot of difficulty with climbing stairs. The staff helped with carrying the luggage up so that was not a problem. As we booked our room last minute and the hotel was almost booked out, we had to stay in two different room types. The first 3 nights we stayed in a double deluxe room (eventhough we had only booked a standard room) which was a very nice and newly refurbished. The room was spaceous and clean, but a bit noisy (but hey it's in the center of the center so that is to be expected.) Furthermore, it looked as though there was a jaccuzi bath in the room, so we got our hopes up by this pleasant surprise only to find that the hotel only turns them on when a guest has booked and paid for it. Fair enough, we didn't book it and I am sure its not cheap to maintain that if guests haven't paid for it. The second room we stayed in was the double standard room, which was what we had originally booked. This room looked a little dated, but still clean, comfortable and with a bath. The room was in the back of the hotel though and as such not noisy at all, but we preferred the view of the square, so next time will request it again. (I suppose for the very light sleepers a room in the back is probably a better option though.) Lastly, the receptionists have been great at advising us on cool (non touristy) places to go and good places to eat. Very helpful! (Best tip: the beer brewery in a windmill;)) Next visit to Amsterdam, we will stay here again and will recommend it to people we know!

Reviews.Title: “Top Location”
Reviews.Author: BeanyMurphy
Reviews.Content: Spend Last weekend in amsterdam at this Hotel with my Husband! Can i start by saying how much i loved amsterdam as a city! So much to see and do will defo return and would defo stay at this hotel. Dont be put off by the bad reveiws. yes its very basic but with a seriously great location. And im saying that and i can be quiet picky! We satyed in Room 19 Which is on the top fllor, Hike to get there but we re young couple so it really wasnt an issue. Room was very clean and airy! At Night it is very noisey so maybe buy some earplugs if ure a light sleep. To be honest it didnt reqlly bothar us but ca imagine it would bother others. The staff in hotel very nice and very helpful with info on where to go and what to do on your break. Great irish bar below hotel. Nice food and lovely staff, its called james gat and its defo worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, affordable and location wise, excellent!”
Reviews.Author: mysticaldreamer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights from 19/09/11 to 22/09/11. It was my first time in Amsterdam, and hadnt a clue where to stay, I just went onto tripadvisor, and looked for affordable accomodation in the city. The Hotel was warm, comfortable, clean, secure rooms, excellently located and brilliant transport links beside it (Tram, Bus, Canal Bus nearby). I was travelling on my own, and good as I am, I still appreciate a well informed staff, and the staff were very helpful, no matter how trivial the query. Rooms and linen were changed daily (nice touch, but not necessary!)The only downside to the Atlanta is accessability - The Atlanta is to coin a phrase, 'the land of stairs' but that is not to detract from the hotel - it is the norm in Amsterdam, and this is an old building, The locals are used to it, so it is normal. It is not suitable for people of reduced mobility. Just putting it out there, it is not a criticism, just being honest and open, in the Amsterdam way! I enjoyed my stay here, be under no illusions, and it will be fine. They serve a continental style breakfast (i.e. no english breakfasts) but that is no matter. The clincher is location - Amsterdam is such an unpretentious, open minded and once you realise everything is located in a circular fashion (the curve of the canals) you will find your bearings, and a lot more besides!!!! fairly quickly. Good luck, and enjoy the trip! lol. TIP: Get the Connexxion Hotel Shuttle Bus (Check their website for times, etc.) from Schipol Airport - it is a direct link to your hotel - and is cheaper than a taxi. The Metro is a bit removed from the Airport, and the Atlanta is a good walk from Centraal Station. You can, however, if you wish, get Tram 9 outside Centraal to Rembrantplein. Buy a 24 Hour ticket (â‚¬7.50) for unlimited use of the tram network. It is excellent. Recommended for Solo, couples, back-packers and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, charming room - everything you need”
Reviews.Author: carlie8888
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in October 2010. We were initially worried as we didn't book a transfer from the airport but after we arrived, it was plain to see that Amsterdam is so organised itself that even the most dipsy of travellers can find their way around. A train straight from ther airport to Amsterdam central station (the stops are called out in nice clear English). Then take tram number 9 to Rembrant square (make sure you leave the central station through the right exit - there are two at opposite ends of the station - if you take the wrong one you'll know soon enough) the tram driver was very kind and didn't charge us because he could see we were hopeless tourists. Each tram stop is lit up on the wall inside the tram and goes out once you've passed it...so get off when Rembrant square (rembranteplein) is the next one to go out. The hotel is straight infront of you when you get off the tram - its big orange letters are very obvious. If you're in a wheelchair then you won't be able to stay here - there are extreemly steep steps going up to the reception area (however this is tghe bature of most buildings in Amsterdam). The staff are very freindly and ask abut your trip whcih is always nice. They give you a big heavy kep which you must hand into them whenever you leave the hotel - the reception is manned all hours so it's not a problem. Always remember the city tax - its only a few euros but worth remembering so you don't get angry when they try to charge you for nothing. Our room was long and thin but plenty of space. A nice comfy double bed with plenty of pillows, A television and a mini fridge with drinks already there that you have to pay for afterwards if you drink them. There is a warbdrobe with a safe - the safe should be free as you simply put your things insise, close it and type in a combination, you then type this combination the next time you want to open it. The bathroom was small - we had a wet room-esque shower (no bath) but clean and with four fresh white towels. Rembrant square is charming and a good base to explore the city. Literally EVERYTHING is just 25 minutes walk away....I walked to the main square and red light district in HEELS! Club smokey (which you can see from the hotel) is a laugh....if you're a first timer in the pot stakes as we were, the nice man behind the counter enthusiastically explained which joints we should smoke and how much in scientific detail. The man enjoys his job. You'll be safe here, a nice square and a nice hotel...lovely people everywhere we went.

Reviews.Title: “Great, no frills clean place”
Reviews.Author: Colleen O
Reviews.Content: The Atlanta hotel is a great no frills hotel in an excellent position. I stayed on my own and had a small room that was comfortable, safe and very clean. The shower was great and very clean as well. If your after an inexpensive room that is clean and a place to crash this is the place. Would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, great service”
Reviews.Author: KWBasha
Reviews.Content: Spent weekend in Amsterdam visiting friends and someone recommended Hotel Atlanta - its centrally located and having coffee in the morning while watching the bustle of the city was a treat. Friendly staff, nice rooms - was a great recommendation

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you get the right room”
Reviews.Author: Chortlepuss
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July. It is in a noisy, vibrant square - an excellent location. The staff were really friendly. Stairs were precipitous - not suitable for anyone who isn't fit. We were given a triple room at the back of the hotel with a view of the fire escape - for which I was truly grateful. It was very quiet (I am a very light sleeper), but I imagine if you are based at the front of the hotel, you wouldn't get much sleep as it is directly above a bar and faces on to the square - busy into the small hours. Nice views, but for clubbers only! I would return again in a heartbeat if I could have a rear room, as the location is so good, but would avoid if at the front. Our room was clean and we had an en suite - there are different grades of room. I suspect we were lucky!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lots of Steep staircases, Not Disabled Friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Spotswood
Reviews.Content: The first thing that struck me was how steep the entrance staircase was, and how small the treads on the stairs were, only half of my size 12 shoes could fit on the steps. This is inviting a claim, as many people must have fallen down this danger. The room was quiet and clean we booked a triple room but got a room with 4 beds. Be warned that this is a very old hotel which resembles a fun house as floors are not always flat, and ceilings are out of level. You really do need to be steady on your feet to stay here. We only stayed for one night but our stay was fine. The problem we had was how expensive Amsterdam is, but that is not just this hotel it applies to the city as a whole.

Reviews.Title: “Horribly noisy location-cheap for Central Amsterdam, with good reason”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMan53
Reviews.Content: Finally got to sleep soon after the thumping bassline music from one of the neighbouring clubs or bars closed, around 4:00 am!! Friendly staff, room unexciting, but oh, what a terrible night!

Reviews.Title: “Never again - dirty rooms and noisy”
Reviews.Author: becka966
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel February 2011 for a mini break with another couple. We booked two double rooms and both were very different, apart from the outdated decor in both. One room was a okay size and had a good sized bathroom with a bath and a shower. This room on the surface looked clean. The other room was a tiny room with a small bathroom. The main problem came in the smaller room's bathroom when we arrived we were very suprised to find hair all over the bathroom floor and blood on the bathroom wall. I went straight to reception and asked to change rooms. The woman on reception said they didn't have any other rooms to move into, which was strange since the sign at the front of the hotel did not say they were full and the fact we had been offered a choice of rooms to be closer to the other couple minutes earlier. She assured us our room would be cleaned and we went out to enjoy our holliday. When we arrived back that night our room had not been cleaned and the bathroom still had hair all over the floor and blood up the wall. Also this room looked out onto the square and was very noisy until the early hours of the morning. This I expected due to the location of the hotel, however I did not expect the builders inside the hotel to start their hammering and drilling very early the next morning. Therefore meaning we were all very sleep deprived the next day. I would not stay here again and would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Atlanta in Amsterdam in a great Location”
Reviews.Author: MisterCheeseman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right on Rembrandt Square. We arrived late in the evening and did not try to go to sleep until midnight. we opened our window and watched the partiers but were to tired to join in. At midnight the partiers were still going strong but we closed the window and the room was surprisingly quiet. About 3am we opened the window to get some air and the partying had subsided but they were doing road construction and they jack hammered until we got out of bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: irishtravellor20
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it was next to the Carlton hotel, where my friends were staying. I did not realise that the toilets had to be shared and if I had known I would not of booked into this hotel. However it wasnâ€™t such a big deal during my stay, actually it didnâ€™t bother me at all. The hotel staff were lovely, the room was nice and clean and the mini fridge was great. Only â‚¬2 per item and it was filled with loads of different stuff. The hotel is on Rembrandt Square and I thought it was good value. Train stop right on Rembrandt Sq. which brings you to Central station and airport. The free internet at the reception desk was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location , comfortable and clean, ignore bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: master666_10
Reviews.Content: Ignore all bad reviews. I went there with two friends in the triple room and had a great stay!! Location excellent and staff very friendly. Great place for young professionals.

Reviews.Title: “dont go here”
Reviews.Author: charlievokes
Reviews.Content: The Hotel room was shocking, nothing was clean there was mouse droppings in the corner of the room along with dust and mouse trap, lights werent workign in the toiliet, the door hinge looked like it could be pulled off, it was just not a nice place to stay in, it wasnt clean, was dull, wanted to be anywhere but there. cleanliness is the most important thing in a hotel and this room looked like other than the bed being changed nothing was ever done to it. its location is right outside all the clubs and due to there not being a horn law all you could hear was car horns.

Reviews.Title: “Atlanta Hotel is a nice, friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TerribleTommo
Reviews.Content: the location and price of the atlanta hotel meant me and my 5 friends left amsterdam extremely high, but also extremely pleased with the hotel. we booked online so didnt know what to expect, but on arrival saw everytthing was clean, the receptionist was very friendly and helpful, giving us directions to here, there and everywhere. the rooms were also clean, and had everything you would need on a stoner holiday (namely a mini bar aqnd TV =) ), although it was not luxury, but what do you expect for that sort of money. also because of the great location in the middle of rembraint square, it can get noisy on a saturday night, although not so noisy you couldn't sleep....especially with the help of some of amsterdams famous herbal remedy. on the whole the atlanta hotel is a good valued, clean hotel, thats in a great location, perfect for any groups travelling to amsterdam, or even just people looking for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Basic Hotel To Explore The Delights Of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sexyshelly
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel you are met by a large flight of stairs which were like ladders,what do you expect though you are in Amsterdam!!!! The hotel room was cleaned every day and the bed linen was changed also.The coffee machine was broken so we were told we could use the kitchen to make a tea and coffee,which was fine until one member of staff was very rude to my husband asking why he was in the kitchen.We were on the bottom floor as requested but you could still hear the guests up and down the stairs. Overall not a bad hotel if you are a heavy sleeper and dont mind climbing the stairs all the time and like being in the thick of the nightlife of Rembrandt Square.

Reviews.Title: “Dont bother”
Reviews.Author: nellalady
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights for my 40th birthday with my husband, the only good thing i can say about this hotel is the location. As you enter the front door you are met with a set of stairs like climbing up a ladder, every time i left my room and took my electronic key with me the tv went off and had to call the reception staff each time to re-programme it as the remote did not work. We had no toilet paper for 2 days despite repeated requests and there was a smell from the bathroom. Also there were 2 windows in the bedroom and one didnt close as it was March the cold at night was unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great but not bad”
Reviews.Author: Prophet-UK
Reviews.Content: My partner booked a long weekend break in amsterdam for my 30th birthday. We were on a budget so went quite cheaply. Unfortunately this was reflected in this hotel. When we actually managed to find the place we realised there was going to be a lot of stair climbing involved ! As we were on the third floor there were four steep (and i do mean steep !) and narrow staircases to get to our room. Our first impressions of the room were that it was small but comfortable, nice decor with celing beams etc. However we quickly realised that our room didnt have a toilet or shower ! At first we were horrifed and were considering going elsewhere but we decided to stick it out for a night and see how we felt in the morning. It turns out that we were stressing over nothing really. Yes we had to leave our room for the toilet/shower but who cares really ? If you are used to hostles you will have no qualms, if you are used to nice hotel then you might be in for a shock. Our room faced onto rembrandtplein so it was a bit noisey at night, not too bad though, im a light sleeper and still managed to get a good few hours in each night. However i would say that the pillows are way too hard ! Our main issue was having no toilet/bathroom. As somebody else also said the sink is so small you cant wash your face without getting water everywhere. In all fairness my other half neglected to check as to whether the rooms did actually have en-suite so you could say it was our fault. We just assumed all rooms had those facilities. There is no restaurant or bar, i wouldnt bother with breakfast either. There is a coffee machine in the lobby area although you have to pay E1 at the desk to use it which was a bit annoying. Still i suppose you get what you pay for. It wasnt bad but it wasnt great either

Reviews.Title: “Poor youth hostel,not hotel”
Reviews.Author: darktrain
Reviews.Content: hotel in poor condition,we paid for a twin/double bed for 3 nights,what we got was a single room with a 3/4 size bed,bathroom was tiny and poorly equipped,tiled throughout but mouldy in places,a broken toilet roll holder,towels with holes in them and very little in the way of soap.The bed was 3/4 size not big enough for the both of us and one had to sleep up against a wall(down to the fact the room was so small).We had a room that faced the square which over new year was very busy and the noise from the clubs was ridiculous..we barely got sleep as the clubs played the same rubbish till 5 am,the windows need attention.All in all a very poor and overpriced hotel...there are plenty of other choices around

Reviews.Title: “hotel in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jason_McKay
Reviews.Content: Hotel located in the heart of Amsterdam Near local attractions, minutes from Rembrandtplein. The rooms are very comfortable & classic. Great service I book this hotel in easyclicktravel.com site

Reviews.Title: “Pay for the upgrade. Staff saves the hotel from a total loss.”
Reviews.Author: expatgrl
Reviews.Content: We were looking for somewhere cheap to stay while in town to run the Marathon. Big mistake on our part. We were given a normal double room and were told we would be upgraded to a Deluxe Double the second day. I was a bit put out by the idea of having to switch rooms but it was well worth it in the end. The management was nice enough to offer us free breakfast both days to compensate us for the hassle but we didn't make use of it. I am still not sure what we paid for since we booked through an online travel agency and there wasn't a distinction between rooms mentioned in our booking. The first room we stayed in the first night was really awful. Very small with only a very small sink in the room--we had to go down the hallway to use the toilet or shower. The sink was so small it was difficult to wash your face in it. The room faced the square (I wasn't aware of what a party location it was) and the windows weren't soundproof. Anyone but a very heavy sleeper would be sure to wake up, especially when rave disco is blaring across the square full force at 4 in the morning). In short it wasn't a good place to spend the night before a marathon and I thought we should have gotten a bit more for what we paid. We also found out when we came back to the hotel that afternoon that our bags had not been moved into our new room as promised and were instead piled up in the kitchen/bag storage room. Glad I had brought a luggage lock. The second night was fine. Upgraded to a deluxe double and it made all the difference. Roomier. Own bathroom. Comfortable bed. The staff at the hotel were quite nice. They were very helpful about bringing my luggage down from the room and then into the street when a running injury barely allowed me to make it down the stairs. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to any of my friends. It may be good for a couple of college types who are in Amsterdam to party.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Bliss984
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in Rembrandtplein which is a pivotal square of Amsterdam nightlife so you can hear some noise especially during the week end when pubs and nightclub close at 3 am but location is so convenient that you can accept this fact. It is within walking from the Central Station and close to all touristic attractions. Rooms and services are good and clean. It has free wi-fi everywhere and breakfast buffet not included but available in a small room overlooking Rembrandtplein. Building is old and so there's no lift and stairs are really steep but is a common fact in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: crooked_weasel
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here, upon arrival we were informed that we had been given a 'free upgrade' to the spa bath. This simply meant a bath with jets, that sounded like a pack of dogs barking when i accidentally turned them on. These busking musicians played right outside our window every night, which was quite novel the first night. By the last night we wanted them dead because they only knew one song... Besides that the room was really clean and spacious, tea and coffee, flatscreen tv, great view of Rembrandtplein, just over 5 mins walk to 'Dam square. We found it on the expensive side compared to similar hotels in the area, but still recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “poor overal quality”
Reviews.Author: nonameBrussels
Reviews.Content: The so called "deluxe room" I had, was hardly a normal hotel room, no soap no shampoo or any accessories in the bathroom (I was glad they were having towels). The room is very noisy, the windows are not closing very tight (I am not talking about sound isolation, or anything like that, because it ain't there).

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: anita1harris
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 33 in the attic, there is 68 stairs up to this room, which was an absolute nightmare to carry bags up to. The room smelt like it had not been used in years it was very dusty, sheets on bed were dirty, room full of family pictures which is very scary looked like people out of a horror movie. Woke up during the night with little insects in the bed. Very noisy good for young people who don't mind were they stay or what they stay in!! Only stayed one night had booked 3 and moved to better hotel at the same price. Would never stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Cheap...”
Reviews.Author: Fosters123
Reviews.Content: ...Cheerful and clean,apart from the showers and toilets that you share! Room was clean,staff were friendly,Hotel nice and central. Toilets and showers were disgusting.I didn't bother to shower for four days!Plus i used toilets in Coffee shops and Bars,far more cleaner. I guess you get what you pay for,i would stay again but maybe for 2 or 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “In need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: TaurusNW
Reviews.Content: Hotel Atlanta is located in the popular Rembrantplein Catch the number 4 or 9 tram from central station (approx 5 mins) or walk in about 30mins. Location is less than 5 mins from the flower markets and 20 mins from the red light district. The hotel is above bars. Reception is on the second floor up some very steep steps (This is certainly a problem at this hotel and you need to be able bodied). Staff are friendly and helpful but the rooms are very poor (Even for a 3 star). There is very little difference between the standard and deluxe. Rooms are small with a poor level of cleanliness. There is a kettle in the room but no cups and only powdered milk. The room I stayed in has sit up bath with shower over. Very deep and even myself at 6ft tall found it hard to get out of. Towels are old,and tatty and not especially clean! My room didn't even have a pillow case and although staying ffor more than 1 night fresh towels, soap etc were not replaced. Whole decor in rooms and landings need updating. Location of the hotel is good though but I found much cheaper alternatives for better facilitites.

Reviews.Title: “second time lucky!”
Reviews.Author: scunnybunny78
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Atlanta, this first was a bit of a let-down because of bad communication between staff. I am pleased to say that this problem has been well and truly sorted! The front desk staff were efficient and genuinely wanted to help! The room was spotlessly clean with no dust etc anywhere, all the 'equipment' worked and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept on for a long time. The location is fantastic for nightlife and everything is well within walking distance (or a short tram ride if you prefer) Thanks for a good stay, I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “they STOLE my credit card!!!”
Reviews.Author: moor1
Reviews.Content: When I got to the hotel they wanted to charge me during check-in. I paid by credit card, and the receptionist "forgot" to give it back to me. When I went up to the room I realized she still has my card so I went down to pick it up. That was the only time I used the card and that it wasn't with me during my stay in Amsterdam. They must have copied it or something, because two days later, after I left Amsterdam, I got charged for thousands of Euros in shops around Amsterdam... BE CAREFULL..!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Frankn
Reviews.Content: Booked two twin rooms at this hotel,when we arrived they only had one twin and one double. The twin was in the attic, the bathroom was filthy (mould everywhere), and to cap it all behind the wardrobe was a container with poison for mice, mouse droppings everywhere. The double, you couldnt swing a cat in it, same problem with mice. How this hotel is allowed to stay in business??? Dont stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Price for the Location”
Reviews.Author: TripTreasures
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous booking the Hotel Atlanta due to some reviews. I even did a back-up reservation just in case (Why ruin YOUR vacation by arguing with hotel staff? If a hotel is unexceptable - go somewhere else. <Check the cancellation policy of the other hotel if you decide to stay> If the original hotel refuses to refund a deposit (I have yet to have this problem since hotels would rather avoid a scene in the lobby) dispute the charge with your credit card company under "services not rendered" ). But I was wonderfully suprised with the Hotel Atlanta! For the hotel itself - ***Warning*** - you do have to climb a very steep staircase just to get to front desk so pack lightly or use backpacks. At the top you are greeted by smiling Suki - she's wonderful ("...And what Suki says - Suki do!"). We got booked in very quickly (TIP - request to have the phone "opened" in your room if you're going to make calls) and she even gave some excellent suggestions on where to go and what to do. We reserved an ensuite triple room. It was like climing Everest (They love those steep staircases in AMsterdam) to get to the room but we were greeted with a beautiful view of Rembrant Square (Rembrandtplein) and three really soft, comfortable beds. Not the prettiest room I ever stayed in but it had everything we needed. The location is incredible! If this is your 1st visit to Amsterdam - this is a great place to start. You can take the GREEN LINE water taxi from Central Station and travel through the canals to get an overview of this wonderful city before exiting at the Rembrandtplein stop (You can also take the Number 4 or 9 Tram from Central station and it'll drop you off 100 feet from the hotel but the Canal Trips are much more fun). You are well within walking distance of fine resturants, local eateries and one "hole in the wall "hambuger stand that DEEP-FRY their hamburgers (not very heart healthy but very tastey). There are also casinos (I know, who ever talks about Amsterdam's fine Casinos), book stores, nightclubs, museums and "coffee shops" (not to be confused with "cafes" if traveling with Mom & Dad) and thats just in the Square!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Experience Amsterdam - Hotel Atlanta”
Reviews.Author: theteflonpm
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel and would stay here again. It's not your typical big lobby, fancy reception, lots of elevators, big restaurant hotel. BUT THE LOCATION IS FANTASTIC! it is centrally located - within a 30 minute walk, you can get to anything of interest in Amsterdam - the museums, the main shopping streets, train station, waterfront, see and photograph all the canals. Step outside the hotel, and restaurants and cafes are to the left, right, and all around Rembrandt Square. Street musicians and entertainers are there on and off. Great bargain is the hotel breakfast - for a flat fee, you can get all the refills on coffee, juice, cold cuts, cheese, cereal, milk, yogurt, bread you want and toast is available. note: Amsterdam restaurants do not provide free refills on beverages. The rooms and bath are clean, beds are comfortable. The Hotel is housed in a block of older buildings - there is no elevator and it has the traditional stairs - a bit steep - to get up to the reception desk from street level and to the upper floors. I found this charming - yes, older folks may find it a challenge. Staff was very friendly and supportive - the hotel has wireless Internet in their breakfast area, so it does offer services to business travellers. And they have a computer terminal at the front desk that they swing around, you can check on your emails and the status of your return flight. We arrived at 8am knowing checkin wasn't until 2pm, they do have luggage storage, they offered us coffee even though we weren't checked in, we freshened up in the bathrooms, then headed out sightseeing, got back at 1pm, room was cleaned and we checked in. While I was there, an international broadcasting conference was on, so the rooms rates were at peak for a few days. Note: on Saturday nights, with the sports bar across the street and the trendy bar around the corner playing music with a heavy bass beat, it won't get quiet until 4am. But all other nights, it was always quiet by midnight. P.S. - our room did not have a clock radio, but the Plasma TV could be programmed to turn on at a preset hour.

Reviews.Title: “Atlanta - great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: BigAudio
Reviews.Content: This was the first of our stops when we went on our honeymoon, and after a slightly shakey start we had a great time! We arrived on a Monday morning, and were unfortunately greeted by a receptionist that said we couldn't check in for another 4 hours! Maybe she'd had a bad night. After finally checking in, we were given directions to a room that was a bit of a let-down given the fact that I'd asked for something a bit more "romantic" - it was a tiny box room with a tiny bed and an even tinier bathroom. However, a little later in the day we were told we were being moved the following morning to a much bigger room, which was absolutely cracking - much bigger, a nice big comfy bed, a jacuzzi bathroom, and a nice view too. Only concerns are : 1) The steps leading up from the Rembrantplein to the hotel reception are quite steep. We had ruksacks and just about managed, but we saw other people with suitcases that really struggled. 2) There're no internal lifts, so if you book and are on the 2nd floor, you've got a bit of a steep climb (typical Amsterdam house type). I'd definite recommend this hotel to others tho!

Reviews.Title: “Completely Rip Off Merchants”
Reviews.Author: TT2006
Reviews.Content: Booked on Internet, and on arrival they didn't have the booking. They promised to refund any money if charged twice as I noe had to pay again. The Hotel was almost full, but they had a smaller room without on-suite as promised in the booking for the same price. The room had large windows that lead into an internal fire escape and felt very unsecure. The only option was to upgrade by 50 euro to another room and since all other hotels were booked up in mid July I had no choice. It turns out I was charged twice and six months later, I am still trying to get the money back and have finally been told I would recieve the smaller amount even though it was their mistake that caused me to require an upgrade. Very unhelpful or sympathetic staff, absolutely no hint of customer service, this hotel is purely looking to extract as much money from their customers.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: cazabela
Reviews.Content: a good hotel for a 2 star, great location but gets a bit noisey at the weekend! room was very basic but clean, bad point was the communal toilet and shower was very small and not that clean. the breakfast was very simple and you do have to wait a while for them to bring you toast. could have done with more then one towel for a double room!!! all staff were very welcoming and we was able to leave our bags there after we checked out as we had a late flight and did not want to carry bags around all day, this i think was very good of them.

Reviews.Title: “Good night, don't let the bed bugs bite!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wilias
Reviews.Content: What a disaster! Our original hotel managed to double book us, however they had booked us into the Atlanta for one night. Atlanta was awful, the stairs were extremly steep, but you expect than in Amsterdam. The room was the worst part, it was a basic room, which meant it was tiny no room to swing a cat! Also the room was hot and stuffy, when we opened the window we were presented with a pigeon aroma!!! It had shared facilities, they were on the landing, but to get to them we had to manouver round the hall way door which was directly opposite the steep stairs, so careful footing required! The bed was small and uncomftarble and worst of all I received bites!!! The breakfast room was ok but the breakfast was poor, no coffee and no one around to ask for some. All in all an unenjoyable stay, if you do have to stay for despiration reasons make sure you get a deluxe room otherwise don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful they overbook!”
Reviews.Author: trishg123
Reviews.Content: Please be very careful when you book here as they have a habit of overbooking. As most people go to Amsterdam for just a few days you do not want to waste a whole day being shunted from pillor to post. My party was of 6 people (3 twin delux rooms which were confirmed 2 days before travelling), we arrived at 8pm to be told they had given our rooms away. They did book us into a posh 4 star hotel but as we didn't know the city we were "hotel" bound that night, couldn't unpack and were very stressed. It was 2pm the following day before we finally got into our correct rooms and therefore we lost a whole day of our 2 day break. I must also mention that hardly any lightbulbs worked and NOT all twin delux rooms have a view. Well unless you consider a slanting tiled roof - touchable (from the bedroom window) and the kitchen vents (from the bathroom window) "a view". The sheets were clean and bathroom OK (not as flash as it sounds) and with earplugs in you could sleep through the thump thump of the several discos in the square! Very good Irish pub below!

Reviews.Title: “I have to agree with this last guy but no there is no but....”
Reviews.Author: CÃ³nz
Reviews.Content: Okay I booked the super deluxe room for a week long stay with my boyfriend. I found the room completely below my expectations even though I had prepared myself for a quirky type hotel (i.e. I knew about the million stairs and lack of edible cuisine). The "jucuzzi" was tiny and dirty. In fact the lacklustre room though it looked neat and tidy was in dire need of a good clean. In fact no one cleaned our room for the whole week we were there and although a cleaner came in mid morning everyday, I actually don't know what she did - the towels were never changed nor were the bedsheets. I had to request more towels and give her the used ones and everytime I was met with the same perplexed look! In fact not only the cleaning staff but all the staff here are plain weird and unobligent. Although I booked a double room and specified that this was to entail a double bed (!!) we got two uncomfortable single beds with wheels - very unromantic -need i say more. Complaining was no use I was told we had the best suite in the hotel! Only that the view and location were spectacular I think this culmination of inadequacy would have completely ruined our stay. At the time we resided ourselves to the fact that we were on a budget but with hindsight im sure we could have gotten a far nicer and cleaner room for the same price elsewhere. I wouldn't return to Atlanta but for some reason Im grateful for the experience! If possible I would rate this place somewhere between terrible and ok!

Reviews.Title: “It was the best of times, it was the worst of times...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okay, so this hotel has some good things and some bad things worth noting. One good thing is the free lollipops offered at the front desk... The usual variety is Orange, Lime or Grape flavor, all with some scary, gothic spider design on the wrapper. Bad thing: the hallways always REEK of armpits, and sometimes marijuana smoke. Also, you may have to sleep on the floor. And it will be on this rock-hard, wooden floor, while being subjected to an infinite supply of Snoop Dogg, Busta Rhymes, and Robbie Williams music videos, that you will realize what it is to be in hell.... That's not even including the carpet of curly, black hairs on the floor of the shower, and the loud POUNDING noises coming at you from all directions... but don't fret: there's a nice terrace upstairs at your disposal... but then again, that is, of course, if the doorman lets you in... If he gives you any trouble, just tell him his brother, Sharma, said you could stay there. If this doesn't work, you may have to bribe him with money, more lollipops, a banana for use in the Red Light District, hamsters, or a conversation on Condoleeza Rice. Throw your arms in the air like S.Dunn!!! I mean... I could probably just do a shawarma.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone who gives this hotel a good review muct be mad!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chris1981
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe so many people give this hotel a good review, I am a travel agent and have stayed in some good hotels, and some amazing hotels, perks of the job which I'm very grateful for and couldn't afford out of my own pocket, but when it comes out of my own pocket I have also stayed at many cheap basic hotels, this is by far the worst ever, location is great yes, but there are many hotels in Amsterdam with equal and better locations, which are so much better value for money, at the time I went, although I booked well in advance I couldn't get any travel industry rates anywhere, just my luck, and my companions wanted to stick to a tight budget so the cheapest we found was the Atlanta, but for what we paid, 87 euros a night, well that was a rip off.....we entered the hotel, had to wait in line at the 2 foot long check in desk while a man was complaining that his room didn't have a toilet or shower in it, they were in the corridor he had now being told, I sniggered behind his back thinking poor man, I'm glad we don't have to suffer that, until I discovered we did have to suffer that... apparently if u read the small print there is a basic room, shower/toilet in corridor, and a standard room, shower/toilet in room, the man made me laugh when he said even in Uganda they have showers in hotel rooms, I've never been there but u get the point, I guess maybe hostels may not have showers/toilets in rooms either, but the Atlanta calls itself a hotel, and based in a major city you'd expect basic facilities such as that in the room as standard, so we check in an they only had 1 room booked, when Id booked 2, no computer to check this on, just a notepad, they eventually said ok well we have another room spare anyway, u then have to pay upfront, when most hotels allow u to pay on departure if u have not already prepaid, they obviously trust noone, then again if I was the check in staff there I wouldnt trust anyone to pay at the end of their stay after experiencing a night in the Atlanta hotel, our rooms were not ready as we checked in early so we were invited to leave our bags in an open kitchen, full of other bags around a table with slices of ham and cheese on, no chef, right I thought, not eating here, no matter how bad munchies I get, it also didn't feel too safe leaving our bags amongst others in this un-supervised room, we left and went out for a bit, came back, checked in, no lift as its a small hotel, up 4 flights of very steep stairs with bags, which is quite tiring when its the 1st time uv been in a hotel with no lift, get to our room, luxury...not, beds on wheels on wooden floor, my cousin stands on bed to look out of tiny window bout 1 foot by 1 foot, bed goes flyin backwards, he goes flat on his face on floor, word of advice: make sure u have insurance if u stay in this hotel, also when u toss an turn in night, or whatever else u may get upto ;) the bed moves with u, the lady at checkin told us although the toilet/shower was in corridor, the room had full wash facilities, this was a very small sink with no plug hole, u can't use it for washing or shaving as u cant fill the sink, so u have to leave the tap running and put ur face down there to splash ur face as required, as u do this u hit ur head on the glass shelf above, which due to the small size of the sink means u cant do more than cup some water in ur hands, bring ur hands out of the sink, throw it over ur face, and then it ends up on the floor, the safe in our room was locked and wouldnt open, the safe in our cousins room was open but wouldnt lock, no box of tissues in the room either, which is pretty standard elsewhere, and u do miss em when u dont have em an have to go to the corridor toilet to get some cheap an nasty toilet roll, onto the toilet review, the toilet room is about the size of a small wardrobe, once ur in u cant move backwards or forwards, they ran out of toilet roll 1 day, it wasnt replaced when we left the next day, we had to find another toilet on another floor and take theirs, onto the shower, again a tiny sink, and a shower head, not attached to the wall, it hangs on a metal clip spraying back against the wall, so u have to take it off and hold it above ur head, and put it down to get shampoo/shower gel, then pick it up again, very annoying, til on the day before we checked out, our mate Reggie from Pittsburgh, who we met on the trip an laughed together bout the hotel, he had a roll of masking tape with him (Don't ask why, maybe he was planning on kidnapping somebody), anyway, he used this masking tape and taped the shower to the wall so that u didnt have to hold it yourself, genius, even tho it looked awful, but then again so did everything else, make sure u read the sign on the back of the door, if u check out upto half an hour late u get charged 50% of an extra nights stay, if you check out later than that u get charged a full extra nights stay, I have never experienced that anywhere, we made sure we were out an hour before check out just to be sure, oh and our rooms werent cleaned once during our 4 nt stay, and no new towels, thats about it, I think iv covered all the bad points, onto the good points.....no sorry can't think of any apart from the location, there are other hotels in Amsterdam, a hell of a lot, that are around the same price, maybe a bit more, maybe cheaper, but are so much better than this joke of a hotel, I have read reviews of people who stayed here in the "honeymoon" suite, with a jacuzzi, sounds good but after staying there I can't imagine it being anything special, certainly not somethin Id stay with my new wife in, I think id be divorced as soon as I returned to the UK, and slagged off for taking my new wife to the worst hotel in the world for our honeymoon, anyone who has done this, how could u...I feel sorry for your wife, DO NOT STAY HERE, EVER! Unless they pay u to, and pay u a hell of a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Noisy”
Reviews.Author: YVRGER
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Atlanta May 13-15 2006 and although I knew of the potential noise problem I took a chance on the hotel because of its great location relative to all the things we wanted to do in Amsterdam. Some of the other reviews mentioned the noise could be sealed out by the windows or it only was intrusive when the bars closed at 4 am. We had a room on the first floor facing the Rembrantplein square and the conversations and buzz from the outdoor bars were quite loud. I could tune out the constant sounds but there were always intermittent sounds of people greeting each other or spontaneous celebrations that alway prevented proper sleep. We tried the optional breakfast once but it was below expectation - sliced bread, coldcuts,cheeze, tomatoes, cereal. - reminded me of camping out. The doubleroom with bath was pretty decent and the bed was comfortable. There was only one desk staff on duty at a time and the times I interacted with them they were preoccupied with their admin work and didn't seem knowledgeable about tourist attractions etc. I would not stay at the hotel again because of the noise factor. It's a hotel for those into the nightclub and bar scene of Rembrandtplein but not for people trying to rest between daily touring.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JennieSW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 7th to the 10th April 2006. We had an amazing time and the hotel is in a fantastic location to access the whole city from! The square that it overlooks is a hustle bustle square and great for people watching. Our room overlooked the square and we loved it. With the windows closed it wasn't noisy at all and we slept right through. I would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone - whether on a budget or not. It was also impecably clean which is always good! The reception staff could have spent less time on the phone and more time smiling but still, I loved this hotel and would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Hotel Atlanta recently and found it to be cozy and friendly. As a lone female traveler, I felt quite safe, as there was always someone manning the front desk. I also appreciated their key policy...you simply left the key when you left the hotel and picked it back up upon your return. My single room was tiny but met all my needs quite nicely. The bed was comfortable and it was easy to control the temperature. Although I occasionally heard people pass in the hallway, noise was not a problem. I hated to leave and would probably stay here again as well as recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not a nice hotel.. Warning!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights for our 2 year anniversary. I'll say now that we are both young and have no problem with roughing it.. This is not the review of someone who has particularly high standards. If you are going to stay here ring before you go and request a room at the back. While you will have no view at all there is minimal noise as you won't be facing the square. The location is fantastic, couldn't complain. Bars, coffeeshops, restaurants, cinemas all within spitting distance and not too rough at night. I recommend Smokey's Coffeshop opposite, absolutely brilliant. Following others recommendations on here we also ate at the Three Sister's Pub - not fantastic. But the hotel.. We arrived at 11am and check in is at 1pm so we left out suitcases in the 'luggage room'. That's ironic - there is no luggage room, simply a kitchen with the door wide open. I'll mention the stairs now, I didn't think they were dangerous (at least not up to the first floor) but don't even bother if you have difficulty with stairs or a pushchair to carry.. They are very VERY steep. At 1.15pm we came back to check in and were left waiting over half an hour as the room was not ready, with little attempt at courtesy until right at the end when I complained. We had gone for a deluxe double room, the one with the jacuzzi. I thought it was well below par. The jacuzzi is a bath with a jacuzzi setting, and not a big one at that. Only expect hours of fun if you are both well below the average size (I'm a size 8!). Our 'double bed' was too singles pushed together. This I've not got a major problem with as I've experienced it before i hotels in Eurpoe. HOWEVER.. They had not taken the trouble to make up two separate beds, rather attemtped to put a sheet across them both which was not big enough to cover them. We had one blanket on top and both the sheets and blanket looked less clean than they should have. There was no duvet, presumably because they did not have a double. The next day we found the two single duvets on top of the wardrobe and spread one across sideways which gave us a little more warmth on the second night as it was -6! We didn't bother with the breakfast but did catch a glimpse of it, there's a reason why it's cheap. I found the hotel staff civil enough but I wouldn't say welcoming. I was disappointed as I'd researched well and I found many reviews I'd read misleading. In all honesty it was the jacuzzi that made me book this hotel and for the money we paid (Â£85 a night) I think we could have got somewhere nicer. However, Rembrantplein is a lovely place to stay and there looked to be some really nice hotels across the square!

Reviews.Title: “Only if you can sleep through anything”
Reviews.Author: richk491
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here unless you can sleep through anything. There are clubs and a casino on the square and some are open till 4:00 AM. The noise is very loud. The room we stayed in was acceptable and had a decent bathroom, although both can clearly use a makeover. There were water stains in the bathroom. The beds were hard to sleep on with very thick pillows and coarse sheets. Breakfast is not included. It costs 5 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Laura S
Reviews.Content: All the good stuff is true. Simple hotel rooms that are very clean. Pleasant front desk staff that are very friendly and helpful. Awesome location. You don't have to go far to get to anything, and some great watering holes are just below the hotel. And the double-glazed window are great for protecting against noise. We were 3 floors above the action, and even when we stumbled in late in the night and the partying was still going on in the street, the windows kept our room fairly quiet. Right off the tram line, so a really easy communute from Amsterdam Central train station -- only 5-7 minutes or so. We stayed here 3 days, and then headed to Spain. Unfortunately we didn't think to book Hotel Atlanta for when we came back to Amsterdam a week later, and it was sold out. We got stuck staying at an awful place, and paid more! I will definitely stay at the Hotel Atlanta again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent rooms, staff,atmosphere,location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last week i stayed at the atlanta for just over a week and had an amzing time. The city is great. I've been there tree times sofar and i preffered the atlanta over the other hotels i had stayed at during my previous trips. The hotel has a perfect location...close to clubs, pubs, museums, shops, everything! The rooms were very clean, spacious and comfortable, the staff was very friendly and helpfull. Furthermore, the bathroom looked beautifull and had a jaccuzzi. My next trip to amsterdam i'll will try to book a room here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for long weekend in June to celebrate my birthday. Was concerned as forgot confirmation from on-line booking. No need to worry though, the hotel staff were very efficient and booked us in very quickly and easily. Our first floor bedroom had the works. Jaccuzzi, shower, and sauna! just the job after a hard days' walking round. Finding the hotel was easy and the location was great being in the centre of centrum! Lots of bars and eateries close by. A little noisy when the clubs tipped out at 5.00 am but only lasted 15 minutes and then all was quiet until rush hour. The trams stop almost right outside the hotel and are a cheap and quick way to navigate the city. The breakfast, although basic continental, was presented in a clean and friendly environment and was far better value than using the bars around the Rembrandt Square. The Bars did offer some good comfort food at lunch time or early evening and provided a good place for people watching. All in all I would say the hotel for cleanliness and friendliness outweighed our expectations and I would definitely recommend to travellers who wish to enjoy their time out and about but wishing a comfortable retreat at the end of the day! Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, for a good Price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Amsterdam(may 12 2005) and had a great time. The hotel is in a great location and the staff is super nice. The room and bathroom were clean! I'd defenetelly would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just spent a week in Amsterdam at the Hotel Atlanta. Overall, the hotel was a solid buy. The location in Rembrandtplein was convenient to the tram system for site seeing, hotel shuttle from/to airport and there were many restaurants in the square for dinner each evening. The room was nice, by European standards a fairly good size. We had two twin beds, a mini bar and the bathroom was actually quite spacious. For an additional 5 Euros per day per person you could have breakfast in the hotel. It was the same food each day, but that was fine for us... cereal, mixed fruit, boiled eggs, toast, coffee and tea. The staff was friendly and helpful. We had an issue with our hotel reservations not getting to them from an internet site until 3 days before we were to arrive (I booked a month in advance). At first they said there were no rooms but they managed to work it out for us. Downsides to this hotel is that Rembrandtplein does have a lot of clubs that do play music until late in the night. We had a back room but still could hear the thumping of music (weekends especially bad). Thankfully, we had ear plugs with us and with those in, we slept soundly. The other downside is that it is a traditional Dutch building with very steep stairs. There is one flight from the street level to get to the lobby and then we had one more level to get to our room. This isn't a huge deal, but I did have my mother with me and she would have preferred to have avoided the stairs if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Jacuzzi, great location, super staff”
Reviews.Author: HBKreis
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a one night stay at Hotel Atlanta. Frontdesk staff was excellent, pointed us in the right direction for a great Indonesian dinner (Bojo) and made the stay an easy one. Room was in a funky location -- had to walk outside a few steps in between buildings -- but was terrific. Hardwood floors, nice sized room. Jacuzzi tub was luxurious in a city where tubs aren't the norm. Window looked onto sidestreet where taxis honked a bit, but the noise just made the city come more alive. Location is on the Rembrandtplein. Tons of restaurants, pubs, coffee shops all around. Easy walk to the Dam, Museums. About a 20 minute walk to Centraal Station. Beautiful canals nearby. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CurlytopWalesUk
Reviews.Content: Rob and i stayed at the Atlanta hotel in sept 04 the hotel is well situated sourounded by pubs and clubs and a 5 min walk to the Dam square. The hotel was clean, tidy and the staff were extremly friendly our room was right at the top off the hotel so we had to walk up several very steep sets off stairs which i think is very dutch. We had a great stay at this hotel Angela THOMAS

Reviews.Title: “Loved Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Atlanta at Halloween 2004. We booked it as our other choices were full and the reviews on this site were quite good. The hotel itself was quite nice - even with the 18 steep steps to reception. The rooms are on the small side but comfortable and clean but you go to Amsterdam to see the city and not to spend your time in your hotel. The staff are friendly and willing and we got clean towels every day. The only down side was our room was right beside reception and very noisy at nite as the revellers came in the early hours BUT if you close the fire doors it does keep the noise down as I discovered on our last nite!! and was easy to get to from the train station - [take tram 4 or 9]. Would really recommend Amsterdam for a weekend break - lots to see and do during the day and nite!. The area Remplainstein was quite busy but not too noisy - loads of cafes, restaurants and bars for a drink and as we're from Ireland there was an Irish bar right beside our hotel - which we didnt know at time of booking either. Hotel was great for a base and I would recommend it to anyone whose looking for an affordable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacaymamma
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 consecutive nights at the Atlanta. The rooms were small as are most European hotel rooms, but who stays in their room?!? Staff is very friendly and even did a couple internet searches for places that I wanted to go to. The hotel is smack dab in the clubbing district with many fabulous restaurants and bars at your doorstep. This is a city that does not sleep from Thursday to Monday, and you will likely not see your hotel room until 3 or 4 in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Basic stay hotel....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have stayed at this hotel a few times over the last couple of years and have always found it provides an excellent location, clean rooms and good value stay whilst visiting Amsterdam. The breakfast is continental (Bread, Jam, Cheeses etc) but there is a bar/restaurant across the road that serves a lovely english breakfast at a good price if that's what you would prefer. The hotel itself is above a parade of restaurants in a small but lively sqaure. It's a 5 mins walk from Central Amsterdam and a 10-15 min walk from Centraal station. We'd definately stay here again when we go back next. Please note this hotel is NOT suitable for the less mobile as you have to climb a steep flight of stairs to the entrance!

Reviews.Title: “Cracking budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: gaynor74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel in April 2004 with friends. It was great. Great location and each room was decorated differently and all in varying sizes. I had to change rooms whilst I was there as apparently they had problem with plumbing in my room but my new room was just as nice. Very central so there was a bit of noise but it did not keep me awake. An excellent base and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rooms, good location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you see a photo of this hotel, my room was at the front, right above the LAT part of the ATLANTA sign. Whilst I had a view over the square, this was not such a good room, what with the pubs and restaurants immediately outside the hotel. Fortunately I d brought earplugs and I'd recommend other visitors do the same, in case you're also given a room with a view !There is also a very steep staircase to get to reception on the first floor.The room itself was actually not bad. It was en-suite with a jacuzi and had all the usual extras including TV and mini-bar. It was clean and the bed was comfortable.However every time you left the hotel you had to leave your key at reception, which wouldn't have been so bad but the staff always seemed so annoyed when you returned to ask for your key. I don't know why they were like that, a smile doesn't cost anything!Overall this isn t a bad hotel, it s a nice central location with most places within easy walking distance. By the way, I m writing this review about a year since I stayed at the hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Atlanta Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Rembrandtplein 8-10, Amsterdam 1017 CV, The Netherlands
